tit.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: かるた（歌留多、加留多、嘉留太、骨牌）は、絵札を使う競技の一種。
sen.e: "Karuta" (in Chinese characters, written as "歌留多," "加留多," "嘉留太," or "骨牌") is a kind of a Japanese game using picture cards.
"Karuta" (in Chinese characters, written as "歌留多," "加留多," "嘉留太," or "骨牌") is a kind of a Japanese game using picture cards.
"Karuta" (in Chinese characters, written as "歌留多," "加留多," "嘉留太," or "骨牌") is a kind of a Japanese game using picture cards.

sen.j: その名称はポルトガル語で手紙、あるいは紙板状のもの、トランプなどを意味するcartaに由来する。
sen.e: The name karuta originated from the Portuguese word "carta" which means a letter, a paper board or the like, a playing card, and so on.
The name karuta originated from the Portuguese word "carta" which means a letter, a paper board or the like, a playing card, and so on.
The name karuta originated from the Portuguese word "carta" which means a letter, a paper board or the like, a playing card, and so on.

sen.j: 元々はトランプなどのカードゲーム一般を指した。
sen.e: Originally, karuta was a general term of card games including playing cards.
Originally, karuta was a general term for card games including playing cards.
Originally, karuta was a general term for card games including playing cards.

sen.j: 現代日本では、花札か、後述する読み札にあわせた絵札をとってその枚数を競う競技を意味するようになった。
sen.e: In the present Japan, karuta means "hanafuda" (cards printed a picture of a flower), or the game mentioned below in which players compete for the No.1 getter of picture cards corresponding to "yomifuda" (cards for calling).

In present Japan, karuta means "hanafuda" (cards with a printed picture of a flower), or the game mentioned below in which players compete for accumulating the most number of picture cards corresponding to "yomifuda" (cards for calling).

In present Japan, karuta means "hanafuda" (cards with a printed picture of a flower), or the game mentioned below in which players compete for accumulating the most number of picture cards corresponding to "yomifuda" (cards for calling).

sen.j: 歌がるたともいわれる百人一首の場合、読み札には短歌が書かれ、取り札には下の句が書かれている。
sen.e: About "hyakunin isshu" (one hundred Japanese poems by one hundred poets), which is also called "uta garuta" (Japanese poem cards), a Japanese poem is written on yomifuda and the poem's latter half is written on "torifuda" (picture cards for touching).

About "hyakunin isshu" (one hundred Japanese poems by one hundred poets), which is also called "uta garuta" (Japanese poem cards), a Japanese poem is written on yomifuda and the poem's latter half is written on "torifuda" (picture cards for touching).

About "hyakunin isshu" (one hundred Japanese poems by one hundred poets), which is also called "uta garuta" (Japanese poem cards), a Japanese poem is written on yomifuda and the poem's latter half is written on "torifuda" (picture cards for touching).

sen.j: 読み札・取り札ともに、五十音に対応しており、一音につき一セットの読み札・取り札が用意されている。
sen.e: Both "yomifuda" (cards for calling) & "torifuda" (picture cards for touching) correspond to the Japanese syllabary, and there exists one pair of yomifuda & torifuda for each syllable.
Both "yomifuda" (cards for calling) and "torifuda" (picture cards for touching) correspond to the Japanese syllabary, and there exists one pair of yomifuda and torifuda for each syllable.
Both yomifuda and torifuda correspond to the Japanese syllabary, and there exists one pair of yomifuda and torifuda for each syllable.
sen.cmt: yomifuda, torifuda→既出のため補足削除、クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 読み札
sen.e: "Yomifuda"
"Yomifuda"
"Yomifuda"

sen.j: - ことわざなどの短いフレーズが書いてあり、読み人（多くは大人）が声に出して読む。
sen.e: A short phrase (or sentence) - for example, a proverb - is written on it, and a person calling the card - in many cases, an adult - calls that aloud.
sen.cmt: ※「フレーズ」とありますが、文字通り「句」である場合と「文章」の体裁になっている場合とがあるので、"phrase (or sentence)" と訳しました。
sen.e: A short phrase (or sentence) - for example, a proverb - is written on it, and a person calling the card - in many cases, an adult - reads it aloud.
A short phrase (or sentence) - for example, a proverb - is written on it, and a person calling the card - in many cases, an adult - reads it aloud.

sen.j: 取り札
sen.e: "Torifuda"
"Torifuda"
Torifuda
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 読み札の内容を描いた絵と,読み札のフレーズの最初の音がひらがなで目立つように書いてある。
sen.e: On this, a picture about the yomifuda's contents is portrayed and the first syllable of the yomifuda's phrase (or sentence) is written notably.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: On this, a picture about the yomifuda's contents is portrayed and the first syllable of the yomifuda's phrase (or sentence) is written.
On this, a picture about the yomifuda's contents is portrayed and the first syllable of the yomifuda's phrase (or sentence) is written.

sen.j: これを読み札を読むのに合わせて取り合う。
sen.e: And the players try to take torifuda faster than others when the yomifuda is called.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And the players try to collect torifuda faster than others when the yomifuda is called.
And the players try to collect torifuda faster than others when the yomifuda is called.

sen.j: 2人以上で行う。
sen.e: The game is played with two or more participants.
The game is played with two or more participants.
The game is played with two or more participants.

sen.j: 取り札を平面（畳の上が多い）に広げ、取る人に見やすくする。
sen.e: All of torifuda are put on a flat thing - in many cases, on "tatami" (floor mats for Japanese-style rooms) - so that they can be seen easily by players.
All torifuda are pkaced on a flat surface - in many cases, on "tatami" (floor mats for Japanese-style rooms) - so that they can be seen easily by the players.
All torifuda are pkaced on a flat surface - in many cases, on "tatami" (floor mats for Japanese-style rooms) - so that they can be seen easily by the players.

sen.j: 読み人が読み札を読む。
sen.e: A person calls yomifuda.
A person calls yomifuda.
A person calls yomifuda.

sen.j: できるだけ早く、読み札に合った取り札を叩く（はじく、または押さえることもある）。
sen.e: Players try to touch (flip, or - in some cases - seize) torifuda corresponding to yomifuda as soon as possible.
Players try to touch (flip, or - in some cases - seize) torifuda corresponding to yomifuda as soon as possible.
Players try to touch (flip, or - in some cases - seize) torifuda corresponding to yomifuda as soon as possible.

sen.j: 先に叩いた方がその札を手に入れる（札を取る）。
sen.e: The player who firstly touches the right torifuda gains (takes) it.
The player who is the first to touch the right torifuda gets it.
The player who is the first to touch the right torifuda gets it.

sen.j: 全ての読み札、取り札がなくなるまで繰り返す。
sen.e: The process above is repeated until all yomifuda & torifuda are gone.
The process above is repeated until all yomifuda & torifuda are gone.
The process above is repeated until all yomifuda and torifuda are gone.

sen.j: より多くの取り札を取った方の勝ち。
sen.e: The player who gets the most torifuda wins.
The player who gets the most torifuda wins.
The player who gets the most torifuda wins.

sen.j: 子供が文字を覚えるための遊びでもある。
sen.e: This game also serves as a way for a child to learn the Japanese syllabary.
This game also serves as a way for a child to learn the Japanese syllabary.
This game also serves as a way for a child to learn the Japanese syllabary.

sen.j: 語源はポルトガル語だが、同様の遊戯は日本とポルトガルとの接触前からあったものと考えられている。
sen.e: The word "karuta" originated from Portuguese, but the game itself similar to karuta is thought to have existed in Japan before it began to contact with Portugal.
The word "karuta" originated from Portuguese, but the game itself, similar to karuta, is thought to have existed in Japan before contact with Portugal.
The word "karuta" originated from Portuguese, but the game itself, similar to karuta, is thought to have existed in Japan before contact with Portugal.

sen.j: 元々は、平安時代の二枚貝の貝殻をあわせる遊び「貝覆い（貝合せ）」である。
sen.e: That is "kaioi" (or "kaiawase"), a game in the Heian period pairing the two pieces of a clamshell.
That is "kaioi" (or "kaiawase"), a game played during the Heian period pairing the two pieces of a clamshell.
That is 'kaioi' (or 'kaiawase'), a game played during the Heian period pairing the two pieces of a clamshell.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: これとヨーロッパ由来のカードゲームが融合し、元禄時代頃に今日の遊び方となった。
sen.e: And this, combined with a card game originated in Europe, became the present style around the Genroku era.
And this, combined with a card game originating in Europe, became the present game during the Genroku era.
And this, combined with a card game originating in Europe, became the present game during the Genroku era.

tit.j: 古典的ないろはかるた
tit.e: Classical karuta cards in order of "iroha" (the traditional Japanese syllabary)
tit.cmt: ※ここでは「かるた」は、「かるたの札」の意味で用いられているので"karuta card" と訳しています。
tit.e: Classical karuta cards in order of "iroha" (the traditional Japanese syllabary)
Classical Karuta Cards in Order of "Iroha" (the Traditional Japanese Syllabary)
tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いのいろはの五十音に対応したものが、最も古典的で有名である。
sen.e: The most classical and famous karuta cards are those corresponding to the traditional Japanese syllabary.
The most classical and famous karuta cards are those corresponding to traditional Japanese syllabary.
The most classical and famous karuta cards are those corresponding to traditional Japanese syllabary.

sen.j: ことわざを使っているが、内容は地域によって違う。
sen.e: A proverb is used in each card, and the proverb differs from place to place, though the syllable is the same.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: A proverb is on each card, and the proverb differs from place to place, though the syllable is the same.
A proverb is on each card, and the proverb differs from place to place, though the syllable is the same.

sen.j: 例えば上方（京、大阪など）や江戸、尾張でも異なる。
sen.e: For example, "Kamigata" (Kyoto and Osaka area), "Edo" (Kanto area) and "Owari" (Aichi area) each use a different proverb.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: For example, "Kamigata" (Kyoto and Osaka area), "Edo" (Kanto area) and "Owari" (Aichi area) each use a different proverb.
For example, "Kamigata" (Kyoto and Osaka area), "Edo" (Kanto area) and "Owari" (Aichi area) each use a different proverb.

sen.j: そこには地方の特色が表れている。
sen.e: The proverb symbolizes each community's cultural characteristics.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The proverb symbolizes each community's cultural characteristics.
The proverb symbolizes each community's cultural characteristics.

sen.j: 「犬も歩けば棒に当たる」で始まるものは、江戸版である。
sen.e: The Edo version begins with the card that says, "Inu mo arukeba bo ni ataru" (The dog that trots about finds a bone).
sen.cmt: ※かるたの中身については、それがどの仮名についてのものかわかるよう、ローマ字表記を敢えて残してあります（以下同じ）。 ※各かるたの逐語訳、及び英訳については以下のホームページを参照しました。[http://www.246.ne.jp/～kotowaza/abstracts.html]
sen.e: The Edo version begins with the card that says, "Inu mo arukeba bo ni ataru" (The dog that trots about finds a bone).
The Edo version begins with the card that says, 'Inu mo arukeba bo ni ataru' (The dog that trots about finds a bone).
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 以下に示すものは伝統的な札である。
sen.e: The cards shown below are the traditional ones.
The cards shown below are the traditional ones.
The cards shown below are the traditional ones.

sen.j: 2008年現在市販されているものには、一部の札が差し替えられているものもある。
sen.e: Some of the cards sold on the market as of 2008 are the replacements for the old ones.
Some of the cards sold on the market as of 2008 are replacements for the old ones.
Some of the cards sold on the market as of 2008 are replacements for the old ones.

sen.j: 江戸いろはかるたの場合では、表現が難解あるいは死語となっていればそれがなされた。
sen.e: About the Edo version, the cards that had a difficult or obsolete expession were replaced:
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: About the Edo version, the cards that had a difficult or obsolete expession were replaced:
About the Edo version, the cards that had a difficult or obsolete expession were replaced:

sen.j: たとえば、「月夜に釜を抜かれる」は「月とすっぽん」に変えられた。
sen.e: For example, the card that said, "Tsukiyo ni kama wo nukareru," which literally means, "The cauldron was stolen in the moonlight night," - the English equivalent is, "Danger comes soonest when it is despised," - was replaced with the card that says, "Tsuki to suppon" (As different as day and night);
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。※「月夜に釜を抜かれる」に関しては、死語である（表現が時代遅れである）ことが伝わるよう、逐語訳も敢えて併記してあります。
sen.e: For example, the card that said, "Tsukiyo ni kama wo nukareru," which literally means, "The cauldron was stolen in the moonlight night," - the English equivalent is, "Danger comes soonest when it is despised," - was replaced with the card that says, "Tsuki to suppon" (As different as day and night);

For example, the card that said, 'Tsukiyo ni kama wo nukareru,' which literally means, 'The cauldron was stolen in the moonlight night,' - the English equivalent is, 'Danger comes soonest when it is despised,' - was replaced with the card that says, 'Tsuki to suppon' (As different as day and night).
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、余分なスペース消去、セミコロン→ピリオドに変更

sen.j: 「総領の甚六」も「損して得取れ」に変えられた。
sen.e: and the card that said, "Soryo no jinroku" (First born, least clever), was replaced with the card that says, "Son shite toku tore" (Make it your strategy to win by losing);
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: and the card that said, "Soryo no jinroku" (First born, least clever), was replaced with the card that says, "Son shite toku tore" (Make it your strategy to win by losing);
And the card that said, 'Soryo no jinroku' (First born, least clever), was replaced with the card that says, 'Son shite toku tore' (Make it your strategy to win by losing).
sen.cmt: 文頭の頭文字を大文字に変更、シングルクォーテーションに変更、余分なスペース消去、セミコロン→ピリオドに変更

sen.j: 「芋の煮えたもご存じない」「子は三界の首かせ」も同様に差し替え対象となった。
sen.e: similarly, the card that said, "Imo no nieta mo gozonji nai," which literally means, "He cannot judge whether the potatoes have got boiled," - the English equivalent is nonexistent but this can be said a disparaging expression about a person who is not aware of what is taking place under its very nose - and the card that said, "Ko wa sangai no kubikase" (Children suck the mother when they are young, and the father when they are old), were both replaced, too.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: similarly, the card that said, "Imo no nieta mo gozonji nai," which literally means, "He cannot judge whether the potatoes have got boiled," - the English equivalent is nonexistent but this can be said a disparaging expression about a person who is not aware of what is taking place under its very nose - and the card that said, "Ko wa sangai no kubikase" (Children suck the mother when they are young, and the father when they are old), were both replaced, too.

Similarly, the card that said, 'Imo no nieta mo gozonji nai,' which literally means, 'He cannot judge whether the potatoes have got boiled,' - the English equivalent is nonexistent but this can be said a disparaging expression about a person who is not aware of what is taking place under its very nose - and the card that said, 'Ko wa sangai no kubikase' (Children suck the mother when they are young, and the father when they are old), were both replaced, too.
sen.cmt: 文頭の頭文字を大文字に変更、シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: また下品な表現が含まれる場合も同様であった。
sen.e: And the card that included a vulgar expression was also replaced:
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: And a card that included a vulgar expression was also replaced:
And a card that included a vulgar expression was also replaced:

sen.j: 例えば「屁をひって尻すぼめる」は「下手の長談義」に変えられた[上方からの流用]。
sen.e: For example, the card that said, "He wo hitte shiri tsubomeru," which literally means, "To try to close the anus after breaking the wind," - the English equivalent is, "It is too late to cast an anchor when the ship is on the rocks," - was replaced with the card that says, "Heta no naga dangi" (Brevity is the soul of wit) [This proverb is borrowed from Kamigata].
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。※「屁をひって尻すぼめる」についても、「下品」な表現であることが伝わるよう、逐語訳を敢えて残しています。
sen.e: For example, the card that said, "He wo hitte shiri tsubomeru," which literally means, "To try to close the anus after breaking the wind," - the English equivalent is, "It is too late to cast an anchor when the ship is on the rocks," - was replaced with the card that says, "Heta no naga dangi" (Brevity is the soul of wit) [This proverb is borrowed from Kamigata].

For example, the card that said, 'He wo hitte shiri tsubomeru,' which literally means, 'To try to close the anus after breaking the wind,' - the English equivalent is, 'It is too late to cast an anchor when the ship is on the rocks,' - was replaced with the card that says, 'Heta no naga dangi' (Brevity is the soul of wit) [This proverb is borrowed from Kamigata].
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 更に、差別的ニュアンスがある場合も差し替えの理由となった。
sen.e: In addition, the card that had overtones of discrimination was replaced.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In addition, a card that had overtones of discrimination was replaced.
In addition, a card that had overtones of discrimination was replaced.

sen.j: 「良薬は口に苦し」はもともとは旧仮名遣いの「れうやく」、「れ」の札だったが、現代仮名遣いの「りょうやく」、「り」の札に配置変更され、元の「り」の札、「律義者の子だくさん」が不採用となったこともある。
sen.e: "Ryoyaku wa kuchi ni nigashi" (Advice is seldom welcome), was originally the card of the old Japanese syllable orthography of "re," but it now becomes the card of the modern Japanese syllable orthography of "ri," so the former "ri" card which said, "Richigimono no kodakusan," which literally means, "Honest and hardworking men have many children," - the English equivalent is nonexistent - was kicked out.

"Ryoyaku wa kuchi ni nigashi" (Advice is seldom welcome), was originally a card from the old Japanese syllable orthography of "re," but it has now become a card of the modern Japanese syllable orthography of "ri," so the former "ri" card which said, "Richigimono no kodakusan," which literally means, "Honest and hardworking men have many children," - the English equivalent is nonexistent - was eliminated.

Ryoyaku wa kuchi ni nigashi' (Advice is seldom welcome), was originally a card from the old Japanese syllable orthography of 're,' but it has now become a card of the modern Japanese syllable orthography of 'ri,' so the former 'ri' card which said, 'Richigimono no kodakusan,' which literally means, 'Honest and hardworking men have many children,' - the English equivalent is nonexistent - was eliminated.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: こういった時代に合わせた変化については賛否両論となっている。
sen.e: There exist pros and cons about these changes of karuta that reflect the times.
There are pros and cons about these changes in karuta that reflect the times.
There are pros and cons about these changes in karuta that reflect the times.

tit.j: その他のいろはかるた
tit.e: Other karuta cards in order of iroha
Other karuta cards in order of iroha
Other Karuta Cards in Order of Iroha
tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 日本各地に、その地方の伝統や名物などを読み込んだいろはかるたがある。
sen.e: All over Japan, there exist various karuta cards in which the traditions and the features of the local community are expressed.
All over Japan, various karuta cards exist in which the traditions and the features of the local community are expressed.
All over Japan, various karuta cards exist in which the traditions and the features of the local community are expressed.

sen.j: 代表的なものに、群馬県全域で親しまれている上毛かるたがある。
sen.e: The typical one is "Jomo karuta," which is popular in the whole area of Gunma Prefecture.
The typical one is "Jomo karuta," which is popular throughout Gunma Prefecture.
The typical one is "Jomo karuta," which is popular throughout Gunma Prefecture.

sen.j: それ以外にも北海道弁かるたや津軽弁かるたなど、各地方でCD付きの方言かるたも発売されている。
sen.e: Moreover, the dialect karuta (with an extra of a compact disc) is on sale all over Japan, such as that of Hokkaido dialect and that of Tsugaru dialect.
Moreover, dialect karuta (with a compact disc) is on sale all over Japan, for example in the Hokkaido dialect and in the Tsugaru dialect.
Moreover, dialect karuta (with a compact disc) is on sale all over Japan, for example in the Hokkaido dialect and in the Tsugaru dialect.

sen.j: 他に、子供向け商品として漫画やアニメのキャラクターを用いたかるたも多く市販されている。
sen.e: In addition, many kinds of kids' karuta are also put on the market, which feature the characters of comic books or animated cartoons.
In addition, many kinds of kids' karuta are also put on the market, that feature characters from comic books or animated cartoons.
In addition, many kinds of kids' karuta are also put on the market, that feature characters from comic books or animated cartoons.

tit.e: Karuta cards whose theme is taken from a literary work
Karuta cards with themestaken from a literary work
Karuta Cards with Themes Taken from a Literary Work
tit.cmt: スペース追加、頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 金色夜叉
sen.e: "Konjiki Yasha" (The golden demon)
"Konjiki Yasha" (The golden demon)
